bibl.title: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 7, 1920

div1.p: Blue orders Carter to go to Florida to assist in the control of malaria.

div1.head: Letter from Rupert Blue to Henry Rose Carter, January 7, 1920
div1.opener:
EHM
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
January 7, 1920.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
Marine Hospital,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Sir:
div1.p:
You are directed, when your physical condition per-
mits, to proceed to Jacksonville, Florida, to confer with Dr.
Ralph N. Greene, State Health Officer, with a view to assisting
him in developing a program for the control of Aedes Calopus in
Florida. You will proceed to such places within the state of
Florida as may be necessary in connection with this work, upon
the completion of which detail you will return to your station
at Baltimore, Maryland.
div1.closer:
Respectfully, Rupert Blue
Surgeon General. P
ans
The expenses incurred in carrying out the foregoing
instructions are hereby authorized.
J H Moyle
Assistant Secretary.
R B
✓
Acknowledged Jan 10/19
H.R.C
